item.title: 摩根大通将于 2026 年在德国推出德国数字零售银行
item.description: 摩根大通周四表示，将于明年第二季度在德国推出大通数字零售银行。【原文：JPMorganChase said on Thursday that it would launch its Chase digital retail bank in Germany in the second quarter of next year.】

item.title: 早间竞标日本债务拍卖顺利通过
item.description: 格雷戈尔-斯图尔特-亨特（Gregor Stuart Hunter）对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望 随着美联储成员发出支持降息的声音，以及日本最新的超长期债务拍卖顺利通过，惶恐不安的债券市场找到了平静的理由。【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Gregor Stuart Hunter Jittery bond markets found reasons for calm as members of the Federal Reserve sounded a supportive note for rate cuts and Japan's latest super-long debt auction passed without incident.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，埃克森美孚考虑出售欧洲化工厂
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周四援引知情人士的话报道称，埃克森美孚正在寻求出售其在英国和比利时的欧洲化工厂，因为该行业正受到美国关税和中国竞争的影响。【原文：ExxonMobil is seeking to offload its European chemical plants in the UK and Belgium as the sector reels from the impact of U.S. tariffs and competition from China, the Financial Times reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 在线杂货商 Rohlik 考虑上市，押注服务和广告业务
item.description: Rohlik 公司创始人兼首席执行官 Tomas Cupr 在接受路透社采访时说，由于欧洲消费者仍持谨慎态度，总部位于布拉格的在线杂货商 Rohlik 集团正在通过向其他零售商提供服务和向食品品牌出售广告空间来增加利润，同时考虑可能进行首次公开募股。【原文：With European consumers still cautious, Prague-based online grocer Rohlik Group is bolstering its profit by offering services to other retailers and selling advertising space to food brands as it considers a possible initial public offering, Rohlik founder and chief executive Tomas Cupr told Reuters in an interview.】

item.title: 中国在巴西的投资翻了一番，跃居第三大投资目的地
item.description: 一项研究显示，随着中巴两国外交关系的加强，巴西已成为中国在全球第三大投资目的地，去年多个行业的数十个项目吸引了 42 亿美元的投资。【原文：Brazil has emerged as the third-biggest destination for Chinese investments in the world, a study showed, with dozens of projects across several sectors attracting $4.2 billion last year, as the two countries tightened diplomatic ties.】

item.title: 独家报道韩国高官称政策机构将主导 3500 亿美元的美国基金，并关注外汇问题
item.description: 韩国财政部副部长表示，作为与华盛顿达成的贸易协议的一部分，韩国承诺向美国战略产业投资 3500 亿美元，这很可能由国家政策机构牵头，根据具体情况提供资金。【原文：South Korea's pledge to invest $350 billion in strategic U.S. industries as part of a trade deal with Washington is likely to be led by state policy institutions that will provide funding on a case-by-case basis, the country's vice finance minister said.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，中国比亚迪将2025年销售目标下调16%，这表明其白热化增长正在降温
item.description: 两位知情人士透露，比亚迪已将今年的销售目标下调多达16%，降至460万辆，因为这家中国电动车巨头面临着五年来最慢的年增长率，而且还有其他迹象表明，其创纪录的扩张时代可能即将结束。【原文：BYD has slashed its sales target for this year by as much as 16% to 4.6 million vehicles, two people with knowledge of the matter said, as the Chinese EV giant faces its slowest annual growth in five years and other signs that its era of record-setting expansion could be drawing to a close.】

item.title: 纳斯达克建议收紧交易稀少股票和中国企业的上市规则
item.description: 交易所运营商纳斯达克周三提出了更严格的上市标准，包括提高某些新上市公司的最低公众持股量，以及加快交易清淡公司的停牌和退市程序。【原文：Exchange operator Nasdaq proposed on Wednesday stricter listing standards, including a higher minimum public float for certain new listings and a faster process to suspend and delist thinly traded companies.】

item.title: 特朗普将关税之争提交美国最高法院
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的政府周三请求美国最高法院审理一项请求，以维护其根据 1977 年一项旨在应对紧急情况的法律而实施的大规模关税，此前，下级法院宣布共和党总统经济和贸易议程的大部分核心征税措施无效。【原文：Donald Trump's administration asked the U.S. Supreme Court on Wednesday to hear a bid to preserve his sweeping tariffs pursued under a 1977 law meant for emergencies, after a lower court invalidated most of the levies central to the Republican president's economic and trade agenda.】

item.title: 中国人工智能芯片制造商汇川技术股价因获利回吐而暴跌
item.description: 周四早盘，中国人工智能芯片制造商汇川技术股价暴跌，原因是投资者担心近期的大幅上涨可能会促使指数追踪基金进行再平衡，从而锁定涨幅。【原文：Shares of Chinese AI chipmaker Cambricon Technologies tumbled in morning trade on Thursday as investors locked in gains amid concerns that recent sharp rallies could prompt rebalancing by index-tracking funds.】

item.title: 特朗普将在新装修的玫瑰园举办首次科技 CEO 活动
item.description: 据一位白宫官员透露，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周四将在新装修的白宫玫瑰园宴请二十多位科技和商界领袖。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday will host more than two dozen technology and business leaders for a dinner in the newly renovated White House Rose Garden, according to a White House official.】

item.title: 美国劳动力市场裂痕刺激降息押注，美元走软
item.description: 周四，美元在本周的波动中走软，因为投资者在权衡显示劳动力市场疲软的数据的同时，还要应对债券市场的不安情绪，而这些数据强化了美联储将在本月降息的预期。【原文：The U.S. dollar softened on Thursday in a volatile week as investors contended with bond market jitters while weighing data that showed a weakening labour market, which reinforced expectations the Federal Reserve will cut rates this month.】

item.title: 美联储言论和就业数据指向减产，亚洲市场趋于稳定
item.description: 周四亚洲股市早盘走高，原因是美联储官员的鸽派言论在全球经济增长担忧加剧和债券市场下挫之际安抚了投资者的神经。【原文：Asian stocks moved higher in early trading on Thursday as dovish comments from Federal Reserve officials soothed investor nerves at a time of heightened concerns over global growth and a selloff in bond markets.】

item.title: 欧佩克+考虑再次增产，油价跌幅扩大
item.description: 油价周四下滑，延续了上一交易日超过2%的跌幅，原因是投资者和交易商期待周末的欧佩克+会议，预计产油国将在会上考虑再次提高产量目标。【原文：Oil prices slid on Thursday, extending a decline of more than 2% in the previous trading session, as investors and traders look ahead to a weekend meeting of OPEC+ where producers are expected to consider another increase in output targets.】

item.title: 特朗普长子持有的美国比特币股份首次公开发行，价值 15 亿美元
item.description: 周三，一家与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的两个长子有关联的比特币公司在股市首次亮相时身价就翻了一番多，这两个儿子所持股份的估值远远超过 15 亿美元，因为第一家族的加密货币业务利益在不断增长。【原文：A bitcoin company tied to President Donald Trump's two oldest sons more than doubled in value in its stock market debut on Wednesday, valuing the sons' stake at well over $1.5 billion as the first family grows their crypto business interests.】

item.title: 美国对挪威财富基金从卡特彼勒撤资感到 "非常不安
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的政府周三表示，对挪威2万亿美元财富基金从美国建筑设备集团卡特彼勒（Caterpillar）撤资感到 "非常不安"，并补充说华盛顿正就此事与挪威政府直接接触。【原文：President Donald Trump's administration said on Wednesday it was "very troubled" by the divestment by Norway's $2 trillion wealth fund from U.S. construction equipment group Caterpillar , adding Washington was directly engaging with the Norwegian government on the issue.】

item.title: 加州立法者投票决定允许销售含乙醇量更高的燃料
item.description: 加利福尼亚州立法者周三投票决定允许销售一种高乙醇汽油混合物，这将有助于降低美国最大汽车市场的燃油价格。【原文：California lawmakers on Wednesday voted to allow the sale of a higher-ethanol gasoline blend that could help bring down fuel prices in the largest U.S. auto market.】

item.title: 陪审团裁定，谷歌必须在隐私权集体诉讼案中支付 4.25 亿美元
item.description: 原告律师发言人说，联邦陪审团周三裁定，Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司必须在一起集体诉讼案中支付 4.25 亿美元，该诉讼指控谷歌继续收集数百万关闭了谷歌账户跟踪功能的用户的数据。【原文：A federal jury determined on Wednesday that Alphabet's Google must pay $425 million in a class action lawsuit that accused it of continuing to collect data for millions of users who had switched off a tracking feature in their Google account, a spokesperson for the plaintiffs' lawyer said.】

item.title: 新日铁与美国工人联合会、克里夫斯公司就美国钢铁交易达成和解
item.description: 新日铁周三表示，该公司已经解决了与美国钢铁工人联合会（United Steelworkers union）和克利夫兰-克里夫斯钢铁公司（Cleveland-Cliffs）之间的所有法律纠纷，这些纠纷与新日铁斥资 149 亿美元收购美国钢铁公司有关。【原文：Nippon Steel said on Wednesday it has resolved all legal disputes with the United Steelworkers union and steelmaker Cleveland-Cliffs tied to its $14.9 billion acquisition of U.S. Steel, which closed in June.】

item.title: 2024 年和 2025 年全球石油和天然气公司裁员情况
item.description: 国际石油和天然气公司已经宣布，由于油价下跌，并在经历了数十年来该行业最大的并购浪潮后进行整合，他们将在 2024 年和 2025 年裁员数万人。【原文：International oil and gas companies have announced they would cut tens of thousands of jobs in 2024 and 2025 due to lower oil prices and as they consolidate after the biggest wave of mergers and acquisitions in the industry for decades.】

item.title: 惠普服务器需求强劲，季度收入超出预期
item.description: 受服务器和网络部门强劲需求的推动，惠普企业公司周三公布的第三季度营收超出华尔街预期。【原文：Hewlett Packard Enterprise beat Wall Street estimates for third-quarter revenue on Wednesday, driven by strong demand in its server and networking segments.】

item.title: 交易日：科技股反弹，就业忧虑加深
item.description: 交易日【原文：TRADING DAY】

item.title: 法国数据保护机构对谷歌罚款 3.25 亿欧元
item.description: 法国数据保护机构周三表示，已对谷歌处以 3.25 亿欧元（约合 3.81 亿美元）的罚款，原因是谷歌在未经用户同意的情况下向 Gmail 用户显示广告，并在用户设置谷歌账户时使用 cookies。【原文：France's data protection authority said on Wednesday it had fined Google 325 million euros ($381 million) for displaying ads to Gmail users and using cookies when users set up Google accounts both without their consent.】

item.title: 谢因公司被法国数据保护机构罚款 1.5 亿欧元
item.description: 本周三，在线快速时尚零售商 Shein 因不当使用 cookies 被法国数据保护机构罚款 1.5 亿欧元（1.7561 亿美元）。【原文：Online fast-fashion retailer Shein received a 150 million euro ($175.61 million) fine on Wednesday from France's data protection authority over the improper use of cookies, a decision the company contested and said it would appeal.】

item.title: 美国之鹰寄希望于促销活动来预测乐观的销售情况，股价大涨 25
item.description: 美国鹰服装公司（American Eagle Outfitters）周三预测第三季度可比销售额将高于预期，并押注于促销和新产品带来的需求，这使得该服装零售商的股价在收盘后上涨了 25%。【原文：American Eagle Outfitters forecast third-quarter comparable sales above expectations on Wednesday, betting on the demand driven by promotions and new products, sending the shares of the apparel retailer up 25% after the bell.】

item.title: 由于设计软件需求强劲，Figma 预计全年收入将超过预期
item.description: Figma 周三在其作为上市公司的首份财务报告中预测全年收入将超过华尔街预期，凸显了市场对其人工智能设计工具的强劲需求。【原文：Figma on Wednesday forecast full-year revenue above Wall Street expectations in its first financial report as a public company, highlighting strong demand for its artificial intelligence-powered design tools.】

item.title: Salesforce 预测本季度收入疲软，股价下跌
item.description: 商业软件供应商 Salesforce 周三预测第三季度营收低于华尔街预期，原因是宏观经济的不确定性导致客户削减了对其企业云产品的支出。【原文：Business software provider Salesforce forecast third-quarter revenue below Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, as clients dial back spending on its enterprise cloud products due to macroeconomic uncertainty.】

item.title: 泰森食品公司称供应链主管违反行为规范离职
item.description: 泰森食品公司（Tyson Foods）的首席供应链官，同时也是牛肉、猪肉和调理食品业务的监管者，在违反了公司的行为准则后离开了这家美国肉类加工企业。【原文：Tyson Foods' chief supply chain officer, who has also overseen its beef, pork and prepared foods businesses, left the U.S. meatpacker after violating the company's code of conduct, according to a statement.】

item.title: ADM 首席执行官胡安-卢西亚诺表示，ADM 的目标是在 2025 年削减 2 亿至 3 亿美元的成本
item.description: 谷物贸易商 Archer-Daniels-Midland 公司首席执行官胡安-卢西亚诺（Juan Luciano）周三表示，公司今年有望实现约 2 亿至 3 亿美元的成本削减。【原文：Grain trader Archer-Daniels-Midland's CEO Juan Luciano said on Wednesday that the company is on track to achieve about $200 million to $300 million in cost reductions this year.】

item.title: 洛克希德-马丁公司赢得价值 98 亿美元的 "爱国者 "导弹合同
item.description: 美国陆军授予洛克希德-马丁公司一份价值 98 亿美元的 "爱国者 "导弹合同。【原文：The U.S. Army awarded Lockheed Martin a $9.8 billion contract for Patriot missiles, the company said on Wednesday, as demand for the missile defense interceptor from the U.S. and foreign militaries continues.】
